$eref.description: Structured values are strings—for example, addresses—that have certain constraints on their structure. Schema.org: http://schema.org/StructuredValue

description: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department. Schema.org: http://schema.org/ContactPoint

___contactType.description: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

$eref.description: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. and programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Language

___availableLanguage.description: A language someone may use with the item.

___productSupported.description: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. 'iPhone') or a general category of products or services (e.g. 'smartphones').
